title: 3D Systems Looks Flat
text:
Ahead of the Tape 3D Systems Looks Flat 3D Systems, like rival Stratasys, is set to report another weak quarter as the industry’s growth cools considerably. By Spencer.Jakab@wsj.com Aug. 5, 2015 2:27 p.m. ET 
3D Systems Corp. and Stratasys Ltd. aren’t quite made from the same mold, but they do look awfully similar these days. 
The collective market value of the leading stocks in the once-hot three-dimensional printing sector has collapsed by nearly $14 billion since the beginning of 2014 to about $2.8 billion today. Both companies have decided to... To Read the Full Story, Subscribe or Sign In Popular on WSJ
